en.title: Ideal Weight Calculator
en.seoTitle: Ideal Weight Calculator - What Is My Ideal Weight?
en.metaDescription: Free ideal weight calculator. Calculate your healthy weight range using multiple formulas including BMI, Devine, Hamwi, and Healthy BMI methods. Find your target weight.
en.summary: Calculate your ideal weight range using scientifically validated formulas to determine healthy weight targets.
en.description: Our comprehensive ideal weight calculator uses multiple scientifically validated methods including BMI-based calculations, Devine formula, Hamwi method, and Healthy BMI approach to provide personalized healthy weight ranges based on your height, gender, and body frame.
instructions: Enter your gender, height, and body frame size
Get your ideal weight range and healthy target
Use the results to set realistic weight goals

calculatorComponent.formula: Healthy BMI: Weight = BMI × (Height(m))²; Devine: Male = 50 + 2.3×(Height(inches)-60); Female = 45.5 + 2.3×(Height(inches)-60)

examples.title: Large Frame Adjustment
examples.input: Male, 180cm height, Large frame, Hamwi method
examples.output: Ideal weight: 79.8 kg (adjusted for large frame)

seoContent.introduction: Calculate your ideal weight range with precision using our comprehensive health calculator. This essential tool uses multiple scientifically validated methods to determine healthy weight targets based on your height, gender, and body frame size. Understanding your ideal weight range is crucial for setting realistic health goals, whether you're aiming to lose weight, gain muscle, or maintain optimal health. Our calculator combines Devine formula, Hamwi method, Miller formula, and Robinson approach to provide personalized weight recommendations that account for individual differences in body composition and structure.
benefits: Calculate ideal weight using multiple scientifically validated formulas
Get personalized weight ranges based on height, gender, and body frame
Compare results across different calculation methods for accuracy
Understand healthy weight targets for optimal health outcomes
Account for body frame size differences in weight calculations
Essential tool for setting realistic fitness and health goals
steps: Enter your values in the input fields provided
Review the automatic calculations and results
Adjust inputs to explore different scenarios
Use the results for your planning and decision-making
Save or share your calculations as needed
Consult professionals for personalized advice
inputsExplained: Gender selection accounts for natural differences in body composition between men and women
Height measurement forms the foundation for all weight calculations
Calculation method determines which scientific formula to apply
Body frame size adjusts calculations for small, medium, or large bone structures
All inputs work together to provide personalized, accurate weight recommendations
seoContent.formulaExplanation: The Devine formula calculates ideal body weight using the equation: For men = 50kg + 2.3kg per inch over 5 feet; For women = 45.5kg + 2.3kg per inch over 5 feet. The Hamwi method uses: For men = 48kg + 2.7kg per inch over 5 feet; For women = 45.5kg + 2.2kg per inch over 5 feet. BMI-based calculations determine weight ranges that maintain healthy BMI values (18.5-24.9). Body frame adjustments account for wrist circumference differences, with small frames reducing ideal weight by 10% and large frames increasing it by 10%.
examples: A 175cm tall man using Devine formula with medium frame calculates ideal weight of 67.3kg, providing a healthy target range of 64-70.6kg
A 165cm tall woman using Hamwi method with small frame calculates ideal weight of 54.9kg, adjusted down to 49.4kg for her smaller bone structure
A 180cm tall man using healthy BMI approach calculates ideal weight range of 59.9-74.8kg to maintain BMI between 18.5-24.9
resultsExplanation: Ideal weight range shows healthy weight targets for your height and build
Minimum and maximum weights define safe weight boundaries
Body frame adjustments ensure calculations match your bone structure
Different methods provide comparison points for personalized recommendations
Results account for gender differences in body composition and weight distribution
seoContent.whoItsFor: This calculator serves individuals seeking to establish healthy weight goals, healthcare professionals advising patients on weight targets, fitness enthusiasts planning body composition changes, nutritionists creating meal plans, athletes optimizing performance weight, and anyone interested in maintaining optimal health through appropriate weight ranges. It's particularly valuable for those with specific body types, medical conditions requiring weight management, or individuals following structured diet and exercise programs.
seoContent.disclaimer: Ideal weight calculations provide general guidance based on population averages and may not be suitable for all individuals. Athletes, bodybuilders, pregnant women, and those with certain medical conditions may have different ideal weight ranges. Body frame assessments should be professionally measured using wrist circumference. For comprehensive health assessment including body composition analysis, consult healthcare professionals who can consider your complete medical history and individual circumstances. This tool provides estimates for educational purposes only.
relatedTools: BMI calculators for body mass index assessment and weight status
Body fat calculators for detailed body composition analysis
BMR calculators for understanding metabolic rate and calorie needs

faqs.question: What's the difference between ideal weight and healthy weight range?
faqs.answer: Ideal weight typically refers to a single target weight, while healthy weight range provides a spectrum of weights that maintain good health. The range accounts for individual variations in body composition, muscle mass, and personal health goals. Most people aim to stay within their healthy weight range rather than targeting a single 'ideal' number.

faqs.question: How do I determine my body frame size?
faqs.answer: Body frame size is determined by measuring wrist circumference. For women: small frame < 5.75 inches (14.6cm), medium frame 5.75-6.25 inches (14.6-15.9cm), large frame > 6.25 inches (15.9cm). For men: small frame < 6.5 inches (16.5cm), medium frame 6.5-7.5 inches (16.5-19cm), large frame > 7.5 inches (19cm). Professional measurement provides the most accurate assessment.

faqs.question: Which calculation method should I use?
faqs.answer: The choice depends on your goals and body type. Healthy BMI method works well for general health maintenance. Devine and Hamwi formulas are good for medical settings. Try multiple methods and use the range that best fits your health goals and body composition. No single method is perfect for everyone.

faqs.question: Can ideal weight change with age?
faqs.answer: While height remains constant, ideal weight can shift with age due to changes in muscle mass, metabolism, and body composition. Older adults may have slightly higher BMI ranges due to decreased muscle mass. Focus on maintaining healthy body composition rather than specific weight numbers as you age.

faqs.question: Is it better to be at the low end or high end of my ideal weight range?
faqs.answer: The ideal position depends on your health status, body composition goals, and personal preferences. For general health, anywhere within the healthy range is acceptable. Athletes may prefer the higher end for muscle mass, while others may choose the lower end for different reasons. Consult healthcare providers for personalized recommendations.

es.title: Calculadora de Peso Ideal
es.seoTitle: Calculadora de Peso Ideal - ¿Cuál Es Mi Peso Ideal?
es.metaDescription: Calculadora gratuita de peso ideal. Calcula tu rango de peso saludable usando múltiples fórmulas incluyendo BMI, Devine, Hamwi y método BMI saludable. Encuentra tu peso objetivo.
es.summary: Calcula tu rango de peso ideal usando fórmulas científicamente validadas para determinar objetivos de peso saludables.
es.description: Nuestra calculadora integral de peso ideal usa múltiples métodos científicamente validados incluyendo cálculos basados en BMI, fórmula Devine, método Hamwi y enfoque BMI saludable para proporcionar rangos de peso saludable personalizados basados en tu altura, género y complexión corporal.
instructions: Ingresa tu género, altura y tamaño de complexión corporal
Elige tu método de cálculo preferido
Obtén tu rango de peso ideal y objetivo saludable
Usa los resultados para establecer metas de peso realistas

calculatorComponent.formula: BMI Saludable: Peso = IMC × (Altura(m))²; Devine: Masculino = 50 + 2.3×(Altura(pulgadas)-60); Femenino = 45.5 + 2.3×(Altura(pulgadas)-60)

examples.title: Ajuste Complexión Grande
examples.input: Masculino, altura 180cm, complexión grande, método Hamwi
examples.output: Peso ideal: 79.8 kg (ajustado para complexión grande)

Medición de altura forma la base para todos los cálculos de peso
Método de cálculo determina qué fórmula científica aplicar
Tamaño de complexión corporal ajusta cálculos para estructuras óseas pequeñas, medianas o grandes
Todas las entradas trabajan juntas para proporcionar recomendaciones de peso precisas y personalizadas
seoContent.formulaExplanation: La fórmula Devine calcula peso corporal ideal usando la ecuación: Para hombres = 50kg + 2.3kg por pulgada sobre 5 pies; Para mujeres = 45.5kg + 2.3kg por pulgada sobre 5 pies. El método Hamwi usa: Para hombres = 48kg + 2.7kg por pulgada sobre 5 pies; Para mujeres = 45.5kg + 2.2kg por pulgada sobre 5 pies. Los cálculos basados en BMI determinan rangos de peso que mantienen valores BMI saludables (18.5-24.9). Los ajustes de complexión corporal consideran diferencias de circunferencia de muñeca, con complexiones pequeñas reduciendo peso ideal en 10% y complexiones grandes aumentándolo en 10%.
examples: Un hombre de 175cm de altura usando fórmula Devine con complexión mediana calcula peso ideal de 67.3kg, proporcionando rango objetivo saludable de 64-70.6kg
Una mujer de 165cm de altura usando método Hamwi con complexión pequeña calcula peso ideal de 54.9kg, ajustado hacia abajo a 49.4kg para su estructura ósea más pequeña
Un hombre de 180cm de altura usando enfoque BMI saludable calcula rango de peso ideal de 59.9-74.8kg para mantener BMI entre 18.5-24.9
resultsExplanation: Rango de peso ideal muestra objetivos de peso saludable para tu altura y complexión
Pesos mínimo y máximo definen límites seguros de peso
Ajustes de complexión corporal aseguran que cálculos coincidan con tu estructura ósea
Diferentes métodos proporcionan puntos de comparación para recomendaciones personalizadas
Resultados consideran diferencias de género en composición corporal y distribución de peso
seoContent.whoItsFor: Esta calculadora sirve a individuos buscando establecer metas de peso saludable, profesionales de la salud asesorando pacientes sobre objetivos de peso, entusiastas del fitness planeando cambios de composición corporal, nutricionistas creando planes de comidas, atletas optimizando peso de rendimiento, y cualquiera interesado en mantener salud óptima a través de rangos apropiados de peso. Es particularmente valiosa para aquellos con tipos corporales específicos, condiciones médicas requiriendo manejo de peso, o individuos siguiendo programas estructurados de dieta y ejercicio.
seoContent.disclaimer: Los cálculos de peso ideal proporcionan guía general basada en promedios poblacionales y pueden no ser adecuados para todos los individuos. Atletas, fisiculturistas, mujeres embarazadas y aquellos con ciertas condiciones médicas pueden tener rangos diferentes de peso ideal. Las evaluaciones de complexión corporal deben ser medidas profesionalmente usando circunferencia de muñeca. Para evaluación completa de salud incluyendo análisis de composición corporal, consulta profesionales de la salud quienes pueden considerar tu historia médica completa y circunstancias individuales. Esta herramienta proporciona estimaciones para propósitos educativos únicamente.

Avaliações de estrutura corporal devem ser medidas profissionalmente usando circunferência de pulso. Para avaliação abrangente de saúde incluindo análise de composição corporal, consulte profissionais de saúde que podem considerar sua história médica completa e circunstâncias individuais. Esta ferramenta fornece estimativas para propósitos educacionais apenas.

seoContent.formulaExplanation: La formule Devine calcule poids corporel idéal utilisant équation: Pour hommes = 50kg + 2.3kg par pouce au-dessus 5 pieds; Pour femmes = 45.5kg + 2.3kg par pouce au-dessus 5 pieds. La méthode Hamwi utilise: Pour hommes = 48kg + 2.7kg par pouce au-dessus 5 pieds; Pour femmes = 45.5kg + 2.2kg par pouce au-dessus 5 pieds. Calculs basés sur BMI déterminent gammes poids maintenant valeurs BMI saines (18.5-24.9). Ajustements structure corporelle tiennent compte différences circonférence poignet, avec structures petites réduisant poids idéal de 10% et structures grandes l'augmentant de 10%.
examples: Un homme de 175cm taille utilisant formule Devine avec structure moyenne calcule poids idéal de 67.3kg, fournissant gamme objectif sain de 64-70.6kg
Une femme de 165cm taille utilisant méthode Hamwi avec structure petite calcule poids idéal de 54.9kg, ajusté vers bas à 49.4kg pour sa structure osseuse plus petite
Un homme de 180cm taille utilisant approche BMI sain calcule gamme poids idéal de 59.9-74.8kg pour maintenir BMI entre 18.5-24.9

Poids minimum et maximum définissent limites poids sûres
Ajustements structure corporelle assurent calculs correspondent à votre structure osseuse
Différentes méthodes fournissent points comparaison pour recommandations personnalisées

Elle est particulièrement précieuse pour ceux avec types corporels spécifiques, conditions médicales nécessitant gestion poids, ou individus suivant programmes structurés régime et exercice.
seoContent.disclaimer: Calculs poids idéal fournissent guidance générale basée sur moyennes populationnelles et peuvent ne pas convenir à tous individus. Athlètes, bodybuilders, femmes enceintes et ceux avec certaines conditions médicales peuvent avoir gammes poids idéal différentes. Évaluations structure corporelle devraient être mesurées professionnellement utilisant circonférence poignet. Pour évaluation santé complète incluant analyse composition corporelle, consultez professionnels santé pouvant considérer votre historique médical complet et circonstances individuelles. Cet outil fournit estimations pour buts éducatifs uniquement.

For men: small frame < 6.5 inches (16.5cm), medium frame 6.5-7.5 inches (16.5-19cm), large frame > 7.5 inches (19cm). Professional measurement provides the most accurate assessment.

faqs.question: Which calculation method should I use?
faqs.answer: The choice depends on your goals and body type. Healthy BMI method works well for general health maintenance. Devine and Hamwi formulas are good for medical settings. Try multiple methods and use the range that best fits your health goals and body composition. No single method is perfect for everyone.

faqs.question: Can ideal weight change with age?
faqs.answer: While height remains constant, ideal weight can shift with age due to changes in muscle mass, metabolism, and body composition. Older adults may have slightly higher BMI ranges due to decreased muscle mass. Focus on maintaining healthy body composition rather than specific weight numbers as you age.

faqs.question: Is it better to be at the low end or high end of my ideal weight range?
faqs.answer: The ideal position depends on your health status, body composition goals, and personal preferences. For general health, anywhere within the healthy range is acceptable. Athletes may prefer the higher end for muscle mass, while others may choose the lower end for different reasons. Consult healthcare providers for personalized recommendations.
